intro: Gochnatia cinerea, commonly known as the pale gochnatia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The pale gochnatia is also known for its ecological importance, providing food for various insects and birds.
